top_comment.author: aussie bloke

comments.text:
+aussie bloke Seriously? "Sex sells" is the reason they didn't have your 
mother model the batsuit. Human faces are better than inanimate objects, 
and Jake's face wouldn't differentiate one video from another. If they "do 
it all the time," and you *know* why they do it, why bother posting a 
comment about it?
It isn't even an especially "sexy" image. Subscribers are going to watch it 
regardless, and it wouldn't attract new viewers in a field of other 
thumbnails of women.
comments.author: R3Testa

comments.text:
+aussie bloke If you're going to make a point, no need to be rude to the 
people you are trying to make the point to.
comments.author: pokewiz309

considered  mildly sexy, will be used as their thumbnail. Happens all the

comments.author: aussie bloke

top_comment.text:
I have a request, The new "Titanfall" Game just came out and its been a 
hit, and i was wondering, Are we capable of creating Titans depicted in the 
game? and if so, realistically can we make one now, and how much of an 
impact would that make in the modern war zone? I can imagine a friggin Tank 
on Legs but, the factors of fuel, ammo, weight, and all that other stuff 
just boggles me, if you can do a video on that, it would be so cool, 
thanks.﻿
top_comment.author: AfKman101

comments.text:
Who knows what can actually happen, i mean i want a scientific view of 
possibilities, not just a person saying: "Maybe this might work," I want to 
know for sure.
comments.author: AfKman101

comments.text:
+AfKman101 Tanks could fire many more different weapons since they are much 
bigger than the titans. And a Titan could dodge and be deployed as well as 
a tank as in it couldn't. A titan would move very slowly and couldn't be 
deployed from space unless you wanted it to be 10 centimeters wide.
comments.author: Butter Man

comments.text:
who knows? a tank is just a metal box with a big gun, ammo, and a engine, a 
Titan however, can be deployed from space, mobile as hell, much more mobile 
than a tank, and can carry a range of weapons, i think thats something to 
really consider, and a tank gets destroyed because its an easy target, a 
Titan can move dodge, not only CQB fight but, fire a range of weapons.
comments.author: AfKman101

comments.text:
+AfKman101 But we already have soldiers and tanks. And they wouldn't be 
more lethal than a tank because it would be very easy to destroy
comments.author: Butter Man

comments.text: but a more mobile and lethal soldier/tank
comments.author: AfKman101

comments.text:
+AfKman101 Yes but planes gave something that was never introduced in the 
art of war, flight. The robots in titan fall wouldn't give anything new.
comments.author: Butter Man

comments.text:
Or would it? I mean when we introduced the Airplane in WW1 Most Generals 
disliked the idea, the plane at the time was slow, bad maneuverability 
ect.... soon enough WW2 was at the gates, and the plane came back into 
affect this time making a huge difference on the battlefield, In combat, 
everything is a weapon, and we just find more clever ways to win.
comments.author: AfKman101

comments.text:
We could probably make a robot like the one in Titanfall but it would be 
bad at moving, hard to armor, and just in general inefficient.
comments.author: Butter Man

captions.text:
Display your vigor with Bioshock Infinite
pins and start the day with a RoboCup of coffee.

I'm Jake and this is episode # 22 of Game
LUT

Cruise down Rainbow Road in your real life
Mario Kart, avoid turtle shells while wearing

a League of Legends Pentakill Shirt and arrive
on time with a classic arcade wrist watch.

The watch displays the time analog style using
asteroids and a seconds ship...and it does
this too...

And now this isn't game related but Doctor
Who cares because this TARDIS Necklace will

leave the ladies weeping, angel see how cool
it is when you have a Geordi La Forge Visor
Ring from Star Trek: The Next Generation.

But lets get back to games by building one...out
of blocks. This NES themed kit even comes

with two controllers and cartridges. You can
put it next to your cool Mario figure.

Or play a fully functioning NES clone console
inside a VHS tape. It accepts famicom, pal,
and ntsc cartridges

While rockin on that console, rock one of
these epic Portal shirts from the welovefine
design contest...

Now that you've got your shirt, grab a Mass
Effect N7 Leather Jacket and an Assassin's

Creed Armored Vambrace. Now you're ready to
kill some Call of duty zombies... collector

set. There are also ones for Alpine Rangers,
Dome Battleground, and Seal Team.

All these Call of Duty sets are making me
feel like a real Patriot...action figure from
BioShock Infinite

Then grab your Mario Bros pixel art cutting
board, slice up some steaks and grill 'em

with Lightsaber.... grill tongs...Or maybe
you're in the mood for a slice of Tri-pizza.

And wash it down with Attack on Titan plum
wine. The limited edition set comes with three

bottles of the sweet nectar and don't worry
there are also 3 plum juices for the kiddos
as well.

You can drink right out of the bottle or pour
it into Pokemon badge shot glasses that perfectly
matches this Pokemon Gym Veterans Polo.

Now pull up those Kingdom Hearts Socks and
be the Batman to my Robin friendship necklace

with the Batman collection at Blackmilk including
a Cape swim suit, long sleeve cat suit, Gotham's

most wanted leggings and link it all together
with a Navi necklace

Since you're decked out in superhero gear,
read the Super graphic, an infographic novel
full of obscure comic book facts.

Now that you're well read, relax and play
a game of pinball on this awesome Xmen Pro

Pinball Machine and decorate your game room
with some lights made from old arcades...

For a more modern fixture there's a Giant
Xbox wall art piece lit with LEDs from behind.

Turn your old controller into a DIY dog leash,
and control yourself with Sega Controller
earrings.

Links to everything can be found in the description
below.
I'm Jake and, as always, thanks for watching.
